This shows that with the expansion of the population, the Han nationality continued to go south and crossed the Yangtze River into Huguang more than 2000 years ago, and finally crossed the strait to Hainan Island. During this process, the Han people who moved south continued to integrate with many ethnic minorities who spoke Dong-Tai, South Asian and Miao languages, thus diluting the consanguinity of the Han nationality in the north.Question: Which of the followings, if true, can best refute the above argument?

Answer:

The researchers fed honeybee larvae separately with fresh royal jelly and royal jelly that had been stored for 30 days. The results showed that the larvae fed with fresh royal jelly grew into queens. Further research found that a protein called "royalactin" in fresh royal jelly can promote the secretion of growth hormone, making the larvae have the characteristics of queen bee, such as larger body size and well-developed ovaries. The researchers fed fruit flies with this protein, and the fruit flies also showed an increase in body length, number of eggs and lifespan, indicating that the effect of this protein on biological characteristics is cross-species.

There is little genetic difference between bees and fruit flies, and they share many of the same biological characteristics. data.sampled:
Answer: D. Different enzymes require different genes to encode.

The passage states that the abundance of transposon genes indicates that they play a vital role in evolution and the maintenance of biodiversity. Biology textbooks generally believe that the enzyme that can fix carbon dioxide in photosynthesis is the most abundant enzyme on earth, and some scholars have speculated that the genes that can encode this enzyme should also be the most abundant. However, the study found that transposons, known as "junk DNA", instead dominate the known genetic world. This means that different enzymes may require different genes to encode, supporting the speculation of the scholar that the same enzyme is sometimes encoded by different genes.

But None of the above do not accurately grasp these characteristics, and they only talk about the income level of the Ivy League's faculty and alumni. Therefore, the answer isNone of the above.

Passage: Ivy usually refers to eight universities in the eastern United States. Ivy has always been synonymous with famous schools in the United States. These eight universities not only have a long history and rigorous scholarship, but also have high teaching quality. Most of the graduates of these schools become social elites, most of whom earn more than $200000 a year. There are many political leaders from the Ivy, and a large number of scientists graduated from the Ivy.Question: According to the above conditions, which of the following options must be true?
A. A.Some social elites earn more than $200000 a year.
B. B.Some political leaders earn less than $200000 a year.
C. C.Some scientists earn more than $200000 a year.
D. D.Some political leaders are social elites.
Answer:

Passage: At the end of 2009, the results of a survey conducted by the Ministry of Health of China showed that only 6.48% of the people had overall health quality, of which only 4.66% had the literacy of chronic disease prevention. This shows that the national awareness of the disease is still very poor. Only when the national quality is fundamentally improved, the fallacies of Li Yi and Zhang Wuben will not have so many people blindly follow.Question: Which of the following conclusions can be inferred from the above statement?
A. A.The lack of awareness of the disease is one of the manifestations that the national quality needs to be fundamentally improved.
B. B.If the quality of the national awareness cannot be fundamentally improved, many people will blindly follow the fallacies of Li Yi and others.
C. C.The lack of basic medical knowledge is the root cause of the repeated success of quack doctors.
D. D.Only when the people raise their awareness of the disease can their health be guaranteed.
Answer:

prompt.content: Instructions: You will be presented with a passage and a question about that passage. There are four options to be chosen from, you need to choose the only correct option to answer that question. If the first option is right, you generate the answer 'A', if the second option is right, you generate the answer 'B', if the third option is right, you generate the answer 'C', if the fourth option is right, you generate the answer 'D'. Read the question and options thoroughly and select the correct answer from the four answer labels. Read the passage thoroughly to ensure you know what the passage entails.

Passage: The results of experiments that some volunteers took part in to assess the sweetness of drinks showed that those who regularly drank sugary drinks and were fatter rated the sweetness of the same drink lower than those of normal size. This shows that their taste buds are less sensitive to sweetness. The results also show that people who are fatter tend to choose sweeter foods subconsciously. This suggests that eating too much sugar may form a vicious circle, that is, eating sugar regularly will lead to a decrease in the sensitivity of taste buds to sweetness, and a decrease in satisfaction caused by eating the same amount of sugar, which will subconsciously ask for more sugar. The result is that eating too much sugar leads to obesity.Question: Which of the following options does not support the above argument?
A. A.There are criterias for evaluating the sweetness of drinks.
B. B.The volunteers were able to evaluate the sweetness of the drink more accurately.
C. C.People who like sweets often can't resist the temptation of sweetness.
D. D.Satisfaction is dominated by the subconscious.
Answer:

prompt.content: Instructions: You will be presented with a passage and a question about that passage. There are four options to be chosen from, you need to choose the only correct option to answer that question. If the first option is right, you generate the answer 'A', if the second option is right, you generate the answer 'B', if the third option is right, you generate the answer 'C', if the fourth option is right, you generate the answer 'D'. Read the question and options thoroughly and select the correct answer from the four answer labels. Read the passage thoroughly to ensure you know what the passage entails.

Passage: Researchers at Ohio State University surveyed more than 13000 middle school students in grades 7 to 12. In the survey, the researchers asked the students to list five male friends and five female friends, and then counted the total number of votes received by the nominated friends and selected those who received five votes for the survey. The study found that among those who received five votes, the proportion of only children was consistent with the proportion of their population in this age group,indicating that there is no significant difference in social skills between them and non-only children, and this result is not affected by the age, race and economic status of their parents.Question: Which of the followings, if true, can best support the above findings?
A. A.Among those who did not win the vote, the proportion of only children was higher than the proportion of them in the survey.
B. B.The proportion of only children who have won votes is roughly the same as their proportion in this survey.
C. C.Among those who got one vote, the proportion of only children was much higher than their proportion in this survey.
D. D.Among the top 500 votes, the proportion of only children is about the same as their proportion in this survey.
Answer:

data.sampled:
A.
The true-footed snake lived at a time when snakes evolved from non-footed animal to legged lizards. The research report points out that the snake is 50 centimeters long. On the surface, it has only one foot, about 2 centimeters long. The other foot of the real foot snake was found by X-ray scanning. The reason why this foot is not easy to detect is that it was alienated in the rock, with only four bones in its ankle and no toes, indicating that the feet of true-footed snakes had deteriorated at that time. This snake is very similar to modern terrestrial lizards, which helps to unravel the mystery of the origin of snakes.
The research report points out that the snake's other leg is only 4CM long. It shows that the true-footed snake is a typical ancient snake with a single foot. The foot was found accidentally in the same rock layerh in which the Bar Opal Rupelian Snake is trapped. The snake is well preserved, but its foot bones are cleanly separated from the main body.

prompt.content: Instructions: You will be presented with a passage and a question about that passage. There are four options to be chosen from, you need to choose the only correct option to answer that question. If the first option is right, you generate the answer 'A', if the second option is right, you generate the answer 'B', if the third option is right, you generate the answer 'C', if the fourth option is right, you generate the answer 'D'. Read the question and options thoroughly and select the correct answer from the four answer labels. Read the passage thoroughly to ensure you know what the passage entails.

Passage: Using the X-ray technology of the European Synchrotron radiation Accelerator, the researchers scanned a fossil of a true-footed snake hidden in an ancient rock dating back 9500 million years. It turns out that this snake is very similar to modern terrestrial lizards, which helps to unravel the mystery of the origin of snakes. The research report points out that the snake is 50 centimeters long. On the surface, it has only one foot, about 2 centimeters long. The other foot of the real foot snake was found by X-ray scanning. The reason why this foot is not easy to detect is that it was alienated in the rock, with only four bones in its ankle and no toes, indicating that the feet of true-footed snakes had deteriorated at that time.Question: Which of the followings, if true, can best support the views of the above scholars?
A. A.The true-footed snake lived at a time when snakes evolved from non-footed animal to legged lizards.
B. B.The true-footed snake lived at a time when snakes evolved from a legged animal to non-footed animal.
C. C.The true-footed snake lived at a time when snakes degenerated from non-footed animal to a legged lizard.
D. D.The age of this true-footed snake coincides with the period when snakes degenerated from a legged animal to a non-footed animal.
Answer:

data.sampled: A.The goals of the six projects set by the Chang'e-2 mission have all been achieved, which means that the Chang'e-2 project has been a complete success. Answer: A. Besides promoting the development of space technology, the success of the project has played a positive role in the country's environmental protection and scientific research. Since the launch of the Chang'e-2 satellite in October 2010, it has achieved successivezonying of the Earth, and through a large number of technical tests and scientific research tasks, it has fully validated 12 new technologies and 7 innovations in meeting the challenge of traveling millions of miles through space. The reliability and real-time control technology of the vehiclerunning and guidance technology, as well as the terminal plunge and target meeting technology, have fully validated the core environmental design and corresponding reliability of the projectile meeting a challenge of travel millions of miles through space. Therefore, it can be seen that the success of the Chang'e-2 project not only brings the country a qualitative leap in aerospace equipment and technology, but also brings corresponding progress in related fields such as environment and scientific research. This shows that the Chang'e-2 project is of great significance for the country's exploration of space, development of space technology, and scientific research. Passage: On the morning of November 8, the State Administration of Science, Technology and Industry for National Defense released for the first time a local image of the lunar Hongwan area, the pre-selected landing area of Chang'e-3, sent back by the Chang'e-2 satellite. It is a black-and-white image taken at 18:00 on October 28th and captured by a satellite about 18.7km from the moon's surface. The return of the camera indicates that the goals of the six projects set by the Chang'e-2 mission have all been achieved, which means that the Chang'e-2 project has been a complete success. The return of the camera indicates that the goals of the six projects set by the Chang'e-2 mission have all been achieved, which means that the Chang'e-2 project has been a complete success. The return of the camera indicates that the goals of the six projects set by the Chang'e-2 mission have all been achieved, which means that the Chang'e-2 project has been a complete success. It is understood that in the future, there will also be a CCD camera on the Chang'e-3 lander. At that time, it will not only take pictures, but also independently avoid the places where the lander is not suitable for landing during the soft landing, and the "immediate decision" will choose a flat surface suitable for landing for the lander.Question: Which of the following options is most in line with the main point of view of the following statement?
A. A.It takes about 10 days for the local image of the lunar Hongwan area taken by Chang'e-2 to be transmitted to Earth.
B. B.High-resolution shooting of the lunar Hongwan area is the only mission of Chang'e-2.
C. C.While in a 100-kilometer circular orbit, Chang'e-2 took a local image of the Hongwan area of the moon.
D. D.Chang'e-2 took local images of the lunar Hongwan area while orbiting the moon in an elliptical orbit.
Answer:
